# Ultra Strong RSA
 cryptography, 920 points

## Description
 A simple RSA maybe be easy to crack, what if we use multilayered encryption, where we encrypt the flag in multiple methods. To crack an advanced RSA Script, study the script well before even trying to crack it.

Not always tools help.

HAPPY HACKING :)

## Solution
Examiining the python file, we see the following variables:

```
p, q, r, s, x, y = large prime
key = x-y
n = x*y
n1 = p*q
n2 = r*s
n3 = n1*n2
a = p-q
b = r+q
c = p+r

hint is encrypted with e, n
cipher is encrypted with e, n3
```

given to us in the outfile are the following:

```
n, e, n1, n2, n3, hint, cipher and key
```


The main thing we have to understand in this problem is that we can retrive the two numbers if we are given their difference and product. suppose the difference is d and product n, then we can write the following quadratic equation:

![http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=x%20%5Cast%20%28x%20%2B%20d%29%3Dn&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0](http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=x%20%5Cast%20%28x%20%2B%20d%29%3Dn&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0)
![http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=x%5E%7B2%7D%2Bx%20%5Cast%20d%20-%20n%20%3D%200%20&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0](http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=x%5E%7B2%7D%2Bx%20%5Cast%20d%20-%20n%20%3D%200%20&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0)

now the roots of the equation will be 2 numbers, one positive and one negative, the postive number is one of the primes, and the other prime is simply x+d. The rootscan be found using the quadratic formula

![http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%20%5Cfrac%7B-d%20%5Cpm%20%20%5Csqrt%7Bd%5E%7B2%7D%20-%204n%7D%20%7D%7B2%7D%20&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0](http://www.sciweavers.org/tex2img.php?eq=%20%5Cfrac%7B-d%20%5Cpm%20%20%5Csqrt%7Bd%5E%7B2%7D%20-%204n%7D%20%7D%7B2%7D%20&bc=White&fc=Black&im=jpg&fs=12&ff=arev&edit=0)


based on the above, here is my python script:

```python
key = 
n = 
x = (-key + isqrt((key**2) + 4*n)) // 2
y = x + key
assert x * y == n
enh = 
# print(rsa_decode(x, y, enh).decode())


# The hint gave us https://pastebin.com/Ss2RBhVN which had the values for a, b, and c
a = 
b = 
c = 
assert a + b + c == b + b
n1 = 
p = (-a + isqrt((a**2) + 4*n1)) // 2
q = p+a
assert p * q == n1


if b-q == c-p:
    r = b-q
else:
    r = b-p
n2 = 
s = n2 // r
assert r * s == n2

# Multi prime RSA
t = (p-1) * (q-1) * (r-1) * (s-1)
d = modinv(65537, t)
c = 
print(long_to_bytes(pow(c, d, p*q*r*s)).decode())
```


## Flag
